title: When should you use a while loop over a for loop? - Quora

response.answer_text: For loops are meant for structure of a fixed size like an array. They are useful when you need to do an operation a fixed number of times. While loops , in the other hand, are more dynamic, and you usually use them for lists or until a certain expression meets a criteria, for example. Let’s say you have an array and need to visit it. You can do it while loop: i = arr.len - 1  while i >= 0 :     useless = arr[i] //visiting the i position     i-- or with a for loop: for(i=o ; i<arr.len ; i++): 	useless = arr[i]  //visiting the i position As you can see they are both correct but the for loop is more elegant and logical. There are many cases where one type of loop is better than the other, what you need to understand is how they behave and then it will be automatic for you to choose the right one.

Typically, you would want to use a for loop when you have a determinate number of iterations and a while loop when you have an indeterminate number of iterations. For example, if you’re iterating through an array, you should usually know how many times you’ll loop. If you’re reading through a file, you don’t necessarily know when the reading should end - you would stop at the point of reaching EOF.
